summary: The Forest Protection and Wildland Firefighter Safety Act of 2025 amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify that permits are not required for discharges resulting from the aerial application of certain fire control and suppression products. The bill aims to exempt such discharges from the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System if the product is on the Forest Service's Qualified Products List. It also makes minor technical adjustments to existing legislation.
